nodes.text: According to the guide to Tool Use, this is a Wolfe class lock. It's a moderately difficult lock and requires the use of the Houdini tool.
(sigh) This is an advanced lock. I don't have the tools to open this safe.
This should be a piece of cake to open. Okay, so it's a piece of cake that takes a lot of time to make, bake, and decorate... It's not easy, but it's tasty when you get it done...
Did I just get lost in a metaphor?
I have the tools - but this safe looks hard! I might need a bit more practice before I can take this one on.
Just as I suspected... this safe is locked!
I'm also pretty sure I don't have the right tools to unlock it.
Woo-hoo! Did it.
Damn... looks like I need to practice my safecracking skills more before I can open this safe.
I have no idea how to open this sort of lock with just a lockpick. I need to get some better tools.
I should put the picture back so Terk doesn't realize someone found his safe.
It's unmistakeably unmagical, and merely mechanical.
There's nothing left. The least Terk could have done is replace his petty cash.
All I see in the safe is some sort of ledger book... sigh. All that work and all I find is a lousy accounting book?
Then again, why does Terk keep a book in this safe? Maybe there is more to this book than it seems...
There's nothing here but this ledger book.
I'll take it to Master von Urwald. Maybe he can make some sense of it.
All I see in the safe is some sort of ledger book... sigh. All that work and all I find is a lousy accounting book?
Ahah! There is 50 Lyra hiding under the book. I think Terk owes me that for all the grief he's given me!
There's only a stupid ledger book left in the safe.
I'd better close the safe before Terk realizes someone broke into it. I don't want him to notice anything is gone.
I'll just close the safe again so Terk doesn't notice anything.
